title: Cognitive Load Theory-Driven Collaborative and Problem-Based Learning Design for Nursing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding foundational nursing theories, practical experience, and principles of adult learning
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical competencies through smartphone-based learning activities and application of real nursing scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can design strategies to decompose complex nursing scenarios step-by-step by applying Cognitive Load Theory.
Learners propose methods to reduce the cognitive burden of patient symptom evaluation by 20% through knowledge sharing among team members in a collaborative learning environment.
Learners develop a systematic protocol to solve nursing problems that may occur in real clinical situations using Problem-Based Learning (PBL).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
